title: FACT CHECK: This man in police gear is neither a civilian nor an ABVP member - Times of India
subtitle: News News: Different photos of a man donning police gear over jeans and T-shirt are being shared by many social media users with a claim that he is an ABVP membe
author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
vclaim: A photo of a man wearing police gear over civilian clothes is being shared by many social media users with a claim that he is a member of Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP), named Bharat Sharma.These social media users, especially on Twitter, are also claiming that this man, who they claim to be Sharma, was among the many Delhi Police personnel who were seen beating a student near Jamia Milia Islamia (JMI) University.This is another photo social media users are sharing while making the above claims about the man.Meanwhile, some Twitter users have also been posting the photo of the man in police gear, wearing civilian clothes, asking Delhi Police why he is not in uniform and if he really is a police personnel.Other than this, there is a photo of another man, again in police gear over civilian clothes, that is doing the rounds on social media with users claiming that he is not a Delhi Police personnel.The man seen in the photo, in police gear over civilian clothes, is a Delhi Police constable. His name is Arvind and he belongs to a special investigation unit of Delhi Police. With the help of TOI reporter Somreet Bhattacharya, we got in touch with a senior police official who refuted the claim that the man in question is an ABVP member. Arvind, in the photo, is seen wearing a normal helmet and not a police head gear.The officer said that Arvind is from the Anti Auto Theft Squad (AATS) of Delhi Police, a special investigation unit, and those in this team are usually in civilian clothes due to 'operational reasons'.Arvind is not the cop seen in the viral video showing a few policemen thrashing a student near JMI University.The social media users are mistaking Arvind for Bharat Sharma, who, as per his Facebook bio, is an ABVP state executive member.The other policeman in question, the one who was actually among the cops who thrashed the student as seen in the viral video, is indeed a Delhi cop. Talking to Times Fact Check, DCP Chinmoy Biswal confirmed the man in the photo above is a Delhi Police personnel and said that he was asked to be in civilian clothes.These are three different people.Times Fact Check has found the claim made by many social media users that an ABVP/RSS member disguised himself as a Delhi Police personnel to be false.
